result.title: ALDREN Methodology note on linking the EVCS to building financial valuation (including the specified annexes).
result.description: ALDREN Methodology note on linking the EVCS to building financial valuation (M18; first release at M12, consolidation at M28-30). Protocol document. NB. This deliverable will also include as annexes: (a) a state of the art and return on experience on some nation-al and local initiatives (ex. Slovakia, also Spain if needed); (b) a description of the integration of complementary indicators in building assets valuation (e.g. energy – health - comfort).

result.title: ALDREN Methodology note on rendering of the collected data and results in a building passport (including the specified annexes).
result.description: ALDREN Methodology note on rendering of the collected data and results in a building passport (M18; first release at M12, consolidation at M28-30). Protocol document. NB. This deliverable will also include as annexes: (a) a summary of available EPC database, lessons learnt and potential barriers. Report as emerging from the analysis of the available knowledge and information with a focus on the possible links and compatibility with emerging databases at national and European levels; (b) a report: overview on existing dataset and evaluation of the BIM integration; (c) a report on definition of the data model of all the collected knowledge.

result.title: ALDREN Methodology note on addressing the gap between calculated and actual EP (including the specified annexes)
result.description: ALDREN Methodology note on addressing the gap between calculated and actual EP (M18; first release at M12, consolidation at M28-30). Protocol document. NB. This deliverable will also include as annexes: (a) an Excel tool demonstrating a harmonized framework which defines the inputs and outputs for the calculated and verified ECVS which are material to its verification by measurements in each partner country in English and the local language; (b) an Excel tool enabling predicted performance to be compared with measured performance, hence verification of the ECVS performance level.

result.title: ALDREN Methodology note on address-ing health and wellbeing (including the specified annexes).
result.description: ALDREN Methodology note on addressing health and wellbeing (M18; first release at M12, consolidation at M28-30). Protocol document. NB. This deliverable will also include as annexes: (a) a definition of indicators of indoor climate based on review of credits, indicators and approaches to promote indoor climate in existing green programs and certification schemes, as well as prEN 16798; (b) the integration of additional indicators as complementary modules to the EVCS, which can be used for building certification related to indoor environment (covering indoor environmental quality i.e. thermal comfort, indoor air quality, lighting and acoustic); (c) a methodology related to data collation in existing buildings; (d) the assessment of the indoor environment quality before and after renovation.

result.title: 10 regional visions for sustainable energy future. (approximately 20 pages, optional in EN).
result.description: PANEL partners working with their regional roadmap teams will work towards developing long term energy visions based upon the methodology described in task 3.4. Key to the visioning process is obtaining feedback and input from as wide a range of primary, secondary and tertiary stakeholders as possible. Thus, a range of different methods will be used to solicit input: • Regional Roadmap Meetings, made up of stakeholders who have been identified as forerunners and provided the full range of training will be convened to discuss the relevant themes from task 3.4 such as Government and the role of state, the presence and possibility of skills shortages, the levels of consumer/citizen acceptance, etc. • Focus groups will be held with specific stakeholder groups to discuss issues relveant to them. For example, a focus group of citizens would discuss the topic from the point of view of non-affiliated consumers. • Expert Interviews for certain stakeholders, such as government officials, individual interviews would probably be more appropriate than focus groups. These will be used especially for reaching stakeholders who have not participated in other project activites (i.e. training from WP2 or participation in the knowledge network described in WP 5) especially stakeholders from outside of the region who still can have an impact, such as repressentatives of state ministries.
